answers.answer: Possible cellulitis, go to the dr. asap. You probably need to be put on antibiotics.

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Yes, cellulitis or infection under the skin is one possibility. This can be dangerous as it can spread. It is more common in people with diabetes. The other possibility is a swollen lymph node—there are lymphnodes behind the ear—or it could be hair root infection.You need to consult a doctor who can examine you, as soon as possible. You will probably need a course of antibiotics and anti-inflammatory agents.Other than this it can be a localized patch of dermatitis or eczema. A skin specialist can help you with this. Take care!

Hi Kaitlin,I had the same thing....infection behind my ear, swollen, red, painful lump. I went to the doctor and they lanced it and put me on antibiotics. I still get them every so often, but not as bad.  Once on antibiotics, a warm compress might help bring the infection to the surface if the doctor feels it isn't "ripe" enough for lancing. Keep the area dry...I used a little bit of rubbing alcohol on a cotton ball to keep mine clean and dry, dabbing several times a day.  Sleeping on the opposite side will help, also...eliminating the pressure and allowing the area to "air".Good luck! I know those things hurt alot  :(Weffette

Hot compress will assist in rising and breaking.  It may drain an usual amount of blood and puss for such a small area.  Spray on polysporin is excellent to assist in healing.  Keep the area clean, take of glasses frequently (if you wear them) and use a warm setting in the shower directly on that area.  Sometimes people are prone to them.  A trip to the doctor may be necessary if healing is delayed.  Antiboticis are good, just not necessary to overuse them.   A topical antibotic, such as polysporin, is often adequate with lower side effects.....Good luck.    P>S>    Increase vitamins to help your body boost it's immunity to fight infections.
